nodes.bodyText: variable name should start from lower case character
sorry about that !
I think it should be class-level constant (Arrays.asList returns unmodifiable list)
since this is a fixed components list i'm ok with it being unmodifiable, don't you think ?

Andrii remark is only to put this list as a class level constant. Agree with that.
Being unmodifiable is ok.

yes, I mean that it should be moven to class-level.
Under list is modifiable - I mean that it's safe to put it to class level because list is unmodifiable and all elements are immutable so it can't be changed and it's safe to extract it to the constant

return Arrays.asList(ERepositoryObjectType.PROCESS_MR, ERepositoryObjectType.PROCESS_STORM)
if it needs to be modifiable - add new ArrayList<>(...)
agreed
IMO exception should be logged as well, in order to not lose information
I think this is done in TUP code, this would not be logged anywhere but inside the eclipse console since it runs on job import ? Thats why i think we can leave it as it is ? What do you think
I don't think e.getMessage will be logged anywhere else. Do we have similar situation in existing migration tasks ?

constant name must be in UPPER_CASE. Also, could you please rename it to more readable version? It isn't clear what does this name mean.
It isn't type safe. Are you sure that all objects are MetadataType?
"Returns the value of the 'Metadata' containment reference list.The list contents are of type org.talend.designer.core.model.utils.emf.talendfile.MetadataType. ", description of getMetadata() :)
Btw, can be re-written to stream usages :)
what do you mean stream usages ? I'm not dealing with lists here ?
I mean Stream API, but it's also good - it's enough readable, resolving
